subtitles.transcript: Of course, it’s a matter of degree. If we ever found ourselves going hat in hand solely to
Berkeley alumni who are in the elite and making huge amounts of money and the hundreds-of-millions-of-aires and billions-of-aires,
we might actually find ourselves in the predicament that many Ivy League institutions and, to some extent, Stanford
finds itself in, and that is that you have alumni who want to replicate themselves and are willing to give
in order to be able to ride off the prestige that the institution gives them,
kind of the reflected glory because it is producing so many people just like them.
